Articles.Content: I thought you might want to know that on unstable release 112.0.0, the life support config menu is not accessible from the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> view. Using only <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> unstable releases and no other mods.

Welcome to the forums.  You'll find plenty of good help here but you, too, have a role to play in diagnosing problems.

You haven't provided too many details which may be important.  Read the post below and try to give others some info to work with.  For example, what version of KSP?  Have you installed the dependencies required?  Did you install via <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> or manually?  A screen shot of your KSP\GameData directory might help, too.

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedauthorid="75006" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed9672897560" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/83212-how-to-get-support-read-first/&do=embed" style="height:197px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

There has been a major update to the [Stockalike Station Parts Redux](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/170211-112-stockalike-station-parts-redux-huge-update-august-13-2021/&do=findComment&comment=4019526) mod. The new parts don't function with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> life support.

This is obviously not a major or urgent problem for anyone not immediately making 5m or 1.875m stations/ships. Just thought I would provide a heads-up for RoverDude or whoever would like to submit a PR for this. Heck, I'm not 100% sure <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> is responsible for that functionality with the new parts or not.
Note that a knight in shining armor already shared his patch in the ssprx thread, bottom of page 73.
Not us.  Either the host mod, Or a separate mod by the community.

> 16 minutes ago, Kharn said:
> 
> 
> Constellation 112.0.0 needs the same fix you did for <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr>-LS 112.0.1-bleeding-edge.1
> 

I pushed out an updated Constellation release at the same time as the updated <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS release. I replaced the previous release though instead of adding another new pre-release. So if you're using <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> to manage your mods, it probably doesn't recognize it as an update.

> 
>

> I pushed out an updated Constellation release at the same time as the updated <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr>-LS release. I replaced the previous release though instead of adding another new pre-release. So if you're using <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr> to manage your mods, it probably doesn't recognize it as an update.
> 

Ah, since GitHub didn't show the same code change, I didn't realize that it had the same fix applied. I'll grab the new zip.

hm not sure what was the problem but on my modded install it work fine now.  

Spoiler

Hello,

This mod seems broken for me in 1.12.2. I can not access it in the Space Center. Button is there but it open only a empty window.

It is a fresh install with both dlcs and only <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> Life Support installed.  I tried both the latest release and the unstable.

![cMC4B4S.png](https://i.imgur.com/cMC4B4S.png)

My log spams some errors when open it. [Logfile here](https://drive.google.com/file/d/10E62AC_DKXafIyIG1E433RLFlVuswAbA/view?usp=sharing)

    [EXC 19:26:40.061] NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an objectLifeSupport.LifeSupportMonitor_SpaceCenter.GuiOn () (at <7cbdc74d251e440abc7a6ec0f58aa14b>:0)LifeSupport.LifeSupportMonitor_SpaceCenter.GenerateWindow () (at <7cbdc74d251e440abc7a6ec0f58aa14b>:0)LifeSupport.LifeSupportMonitor_SpaceCenter.OnWindow (System.Int32 windowId) (at <7cbdc74d251e440abc7a6ec0f58aa14b>:0)UnityEngine.GUILayout+LayoutedWindow.DoWindow (System.Int32 windowID) (at <58f888e0d56a4620958c8e58a768c70d>:0)UnityEngine.GUI.CallWindowDelegate (UnityEngine.GUI+WindowFunction func, System.Int32 id, System.Int32 instanceID, UnityEngine.GUISkin _skin, System.Int32 forceRect, System.Single width, System.Single height, UnityEngine.GUIStyle style) (at <58f888e0d56a4620958c8e58a768c70d>:0)UnityEngine.DebugLogHandler:LogException(Exception, Object)ModuleManager.UnityLogHandle.InterceptLogHandler:LogException(Exception, Object)UnityEngine.Debug:CallOverridenDebugHandler(Exception, Object)

I ran into a problem with the hab time and the homesickness. Both are indefinitely. I didn’t change any settings. How can I fix that?

I'm having an issue and i think it is related to this mod. I have a station under 100 parts in <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit"><abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr></abbr>. For some reason, whenever I get near the station or switch to it, I get 6 FPS. I tested the station in another save, and got 60 fps. Console log is getting spammed by:

[<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr>-LS ]Vessel situation changed, refreshing life support

Over 120 mods KSP 1.12.2

Given that it's not a global issue (i.e. I don't have everyone screaming), and given you have that many mods, not much I can do here - either a borked save or a conflict.  This vessel or all vessels?  Which USILS version? etc.

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, RoverDude said:
> 
> 
> Given that it's not a global issue (i.e. I don't have everyone screaming), and given you have that many mods, not much I can do here - either a borked save or a conflict.  This vessel or all vessels?  Which USILS version? etc.
> 

Yeah, I mostly wanted to know if anyone had ever seen anything similar. It only happened with that single instance of a vessel, I put an identical one in orbit and it didn't lag or spam the log so I'm guessing it has something to do with the kerbals on it interacting with the various life support modules. One intersting thing though, I used Set orbit to move the glitched vessel around, and it only seemed to lag in orbit around Eve and Kerbin. It was fine around Mun and Moho. So perhaps it has something to do with atmospheres.

So I finally decided to move on to KSP 1.12.2 from 1.11. Until now, I've never had an issue with any of the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> mods not working. In 1.12.2 however, I can't get the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> LS icon to show up on the toolbar in ANY location. This includes <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center"><abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr></abbr>, <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr></abbr>, or space.

This is on a fresh install of KSP, and with very few mods. I am guessing I am just missing a dependency perhaps? Or something else that I might be overlooking? I saw in earlier posts, people were able to get it running in 1.12 with the most recent release.

The issue happens to me in brand new sandbox, as well as new career.

Should also mention Ive started completely fresh, installing KSP, and then the mods 3 times now while trying to figure this out.

<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> LS - 112.0.1-bleeding-edge.1

KSP - 1.12.2

Breaking Ground - 1.7.1

Making History - 1.12.1

**Edited <time datetime="2021-09-22T02:14:37Z" title="09/22/2021 02:14  AM" data-short="2 yr">September 22, 2021</time> by Hudsonkm**

So I removed the mods, and then downloaded the combined unstable 112.0.0 release with all <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> mods in it. Now I can see the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> life support icon. Not entirely sure why I couldn't get it to work with just <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> LS. 

After installing the combined pack, everything was working fine. But then I went and replaced the version in that total package with the newest bleeding edge LS release. At that point the issue returned where I couldn't see the icon no matter where I was.

>

> After installing the combined pack, everything was working fine. But then I went and replaced the version in that total package with the newest bleeding edge LS release. At that point the issue returned where I couldn't see the icon no matter where I was.
> 

It would appear that only a few files and the directories inside "UmbraSpaceIndustries/LifeSupport"  are included in the two 1.12 versions of the mod.  Also, it should be noted that only the "UmbraSpaceIndusties" directory is in "GameData" in this versions.  This means the plugin and associated data is missing, and we only get the parts.  My guess is that people are downloading the mod from the repository page- which is mostly old version stuff- and that is why this isn't getting as much attention as it should be.  I think the way you did it is the smart way for now.

![FkzExcL.png](https://i.imgur.com/FkzExcL.png)
